newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey and Turk Cypriot military to act together.
newsitem.headline: Turkey and Turk Cypriot military to act together.

text.p: Turkey and the Turkish Cypriot breakaway state on Monday vowed to act together under a "joint military concept" in any attack against them on the divided island of Cyprus.

"Any aggression...directed against Turkey or the (Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus) TRNC will be jointly confronted and the military planning and coordination necessary for this will be done," the two sides said in a joint statement after high-level talks.
Tension on Cyprus has risen since the Cypriot government announced the planned purchase of Russian-made anti-aircraft missiles earlier this month.
Turkey, which backs the Turkish Cypriot enclave in the north of the island, has threatened to strike Greek Cypriot targets if the missiles deployment goes ahead.

"Any attack against the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus will be considered as an attack against the Republic of Turkey," said the statement, released after talks between Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash and Turkish President Suleyman Demirel.
It said Turkey and its ethnic kin on Cyprus would establish "a joint military concept" on the island.
Turkey's rival Greece has a military pact with the internationally-recognised Cyprus government, which controls an almost wholly Greek Cypriot-populated area.
Cyprus has been divided since Turkey invaded in 1974 in response to a Greek Cypriot coup backed by Athens. Ankara keeps around 30,000 troops in the northern third of the island.
